function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Conducting mass gatherings and events without restrictions","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Funerals conducted in homes leading to transmission of viruses","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Timing of community mitigation measures impacting effectiveness","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Socio-economic and region-specific factors associated with the spread of covid-19 at an ecological level.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contagious diseases propagation due to group-level analysis","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Low socioeconomic status as a risk factor for contagious diseases","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of socio-economic factors on covid-19 transmission","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Spillover effects and interlinked spread of covid-19 between neighboring regions","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Influence of dwelling size, tourism, and sectoral structure on covid-19 transmission","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited analysis of socio-economic risk factors for covid-19 in germany","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Failure to consider socio-economic covariates in spatial analysis","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Retrospective ecological study on the level of administrative districts and district-free cities in germany.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on officially recorded covid-19 cases, which are a lower limit of the actual number of cases present.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of socio-economic, demographic, and health-related covariables from public sources.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Contagious disease spread impacted by region type, population density, and economic status","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Complex interactions of socioeconomic factors with infection spread","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Faster diffusion of knowledge among academics may facilitate mitigation strategies, increasing the risk of infection spread.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Industry share of the workforce may indicate a lack of opportunities for remote work, potentially favoring the occurrence of infection within the workforce.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Immigration for humanitarian reasons variable may indicate a diverse population with varying levels of flexibility in work arrangements and living conditions, posing potential infection spread challenges.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Low overall correlation between variables","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Spatial autocorrelation and spatial spillover effects","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of geocodes and spatial weighting matrices","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Discussing covid-19 in the context of econometric analysis","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inefficient ols estimation due to spatial structure in error terms","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Positive influence of employees in nursing professions on infection numbers","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential association between academic share and infections","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Age demographic influence on infection risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High regional physician density may reduce the number of covid-19 cases","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Population density has a significant impact on infections","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Negative influence of schoolchildren and childcare rate on infections","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unclear reference to regions and their average age","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Misinterpretation of significance level risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unconfirmed effects of nursing on infection incidence in older regions","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Mortality as a time-constant variable","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insignificant interaction effects","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Spatial dependency of risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of spatial econometric models to capture indirect spillover effects.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High density of pupils
